article:
An 'entry', in trick-taking card games such as bridge, is a means of gaining the
lead in a particular hand, i.e. winning the trick in that hand.
Gaining the lead when some other player (including one's partner) led to the
previous trick is referred to as entering one's hand; a card that wins a trick
to which another player made the lead (except to the last trick) is therefore
known as an entry card.
